description: Explore the fundamental building blocks of matter through Ghanaian contexts. Learn atomic structure, electron configuration, and their applications in local industries.
creator: Ghana STEM Learning Platform

tasks.title: Welcome to the Atomic World
tasks.description: Begin your journey into atomic structure by understanding the basic components of atoms and their significance in Ghanaian chemistry.

questions.question: What are the three main subatomic particles found in an atom?
questions.explanation: Atoms consist of three main subatomic particles: protons (positively charged), neutrons (neutral), and electrons (negatively charged).

questions.question: In Ghana's gold mining industry, what element symbol represents gold?
questions.explanation: Gold is represented by the symbol 'Au' from the Latin word 'aurum'. Ghana is one of Africa's leading gold producers.

hints: Think about the basic structure of an atom
tasks.completionMessage: Great! You've mastered the basics of atomic structure. Now let's explore how electrons are arranged.

tasks.title: Electron Configuration Challenge
tasks.description: Learn how electrons are arranged around the nucleus and practice writing electron configurations for common elements.

questions.question: What is the maximum number of electrons that can occupy the first energy level (n=1)?
questions.explanation: The first energy level can hold a maximum of 2 electrons according to the formula 2n¬≤.

questions.question: Write the electron configuration for carbon (C) which has 6 electrons.
questions.explanation: Carbon has 6 electrons: 2 in the 1s orbital, 2 in the 2s orbital, and 2 in the 2p orbitals.

questions.question: Which rule states that electrons fill orbitals of lower energy first?
questions.explanation: The Aufbau principle states that electrons fill orbitals of lower energy before filling higher energy orbitals.

hints: Electrons fill from lowest to highest energy
Use the periodic table to help with configurations
tasks.completionMessage: Excellent! You're now an electron configuration expert. Let's move to practical applications.

tasks.title: Ghanaian Applications
tasks.description: Explore how atomic structure knowledge applies to Ghana's industries and daily life.

questions.question: In Ghana's cocoa farming, what element is essential for plant growth and is found in fertilizers?
questions.explanation: Nitrogen (N) is essential for plant growth and is a key component of fertilizers used in Ghana's cocoa farming.

questions.question: What is the atomic number of the element that makes up about 78% of Earth's atmosphere and is essential for breathing?
questions.explanation: Nitrogen has atomic number 7 and makes up about 78% of Earth's atmosphere.

questions.question: Which of these elements is commonly used in Ghana's traditional medicine and has atomic number 79?
questions.explanation: Gold (Au) has atomic number 79 and is used in traditional medicine in Ghana.

hints: Think about what plants need to grow
tasks.completionMessage: Fantastic! You've connected atomic structure to real-world applications in Ghana.

tasks.title: Practical Lab Exercise
tasks.description: Complete a virtual lab exercise to identify elements and their properties.

questions.question: If an element has 11 protons, 12 neutrons, and 11 electrons, what is its mass number?
What element has the electron configuration 1s¬≤2s¬≤2p‚Å∂3s¬π?
questions.explanation: This configuration represents sodium (Na) with 11 electrons.

hints: Count the total electrons in the configuration
Use the periodic table to identify the element
tasks.completionMessage: Outstanding! You've completed the virtual lab successfully.

tasks.title: Final Challenge: Element Detective
tasks.description: Use your knowledge to solve a mystery involving element identification and properties.

questions.question: You're a chemist working in Ghana's mining industry. You've found a sample that contains an element with 79 protons. What element is this, and what are three of its key properties?
questions.correctAnswer: Gold (Au) - Properties: 1) Shiny yellow metal, 2) Excellent conductor of electricity, 3) Resistant to corrosion
questions.explanation: Gold (Au) has atomic number 79. It's a precious metal with distinctive properties including its color, conductivity, and corrosion resistance.

questions.question: Which of these elements would you expect to have similar chemical properties to gold?
questions.explanation: Silver (Ag) is in the same group as gold and has similar chemical properties.

hints: Use the periodic table to find element 79
Consider which elements are in the same group
Think about what makes gold valuable
tasks.completionMessage: Congratulations! You've completed the Atomic Structure room and earned the 'Atomic Explorer' badge!

learningOutcomes: Understand atomic structure and subatomic particles
